A quick update on the proposed XML dialect(s).

For the time being I have put the neat-run-config.xml to one side to 
concentrate on the neat-output-xml and developing a C# NEAT. I have 
created a new folder in the files area, in it are 3 files:

neat-run-output.xml        [An example output file]
neat-run-output.xsd        [An XML Schema Definition file that formally 
describes the proposed dialect]
neat-run-output-xsd.gif   [A diagram of the XSD - hopefully a lot easier 
to understand than the raw XSD]

As I work through the C# implementation I expect to initially hard code 
the config parameters and to output the results as XML. This then lays a 
foundation for authoring new XSLTs (and perhaps modifying existing ones) 
to create some nice reports and SVG diagrams.


If you look through these files you will see that I have retained the 
config data but I  have made it optional. This gives the opportunity for 
an XML saving routine to output this data if you want to - I think it's 
quite useful to have this at the top of an output file so that it can 
easily be seen which domain, config parameters, etc where used to 
generate the output file.

Colin.
